description: Tatars are a cavalry civilization that excel in hit-and-run tactics and have a powerful late game army.
dark_age: Start with 3 villagers, 1 sheep and 2 cows.
Build 2 houses, a lumber camp and a mill near berries.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Use the scout to explore the map and find resources.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 12-13 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 800-1000 food, 200-300 wood, and 100-150 gold at the end of the Dark Age.
Assign 5-6 villagers to food, 2-3 to wood, and 1-2 to gold.
feudal_age: Build a blacksmith and market to upgrade cavalry units and sell excess resources for gold.
Train additional scouts and research Bloodlines upgrade.
Advance to Castle Age at around 19-20 minutes with 800 food and 400 gold.
Have around 1500-2000 food, 500-600 wood, 400-500 gold, and 200-300 stone at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 8-10 villagers to food, 5-6 to wood, 3-4 to gold, and 1-2 to stone.
castle_age: Continue producing cavalry units and research Husbandry and Thumb Ring upgrades.
Build a second and third stable to produce more cavalry units.
Build a university and research Ballistics and Chemistry to improve the attack of ranged units.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 30-31 minutes with 1000 food, 1000 gold, and 800 stone.
Have around 3000-3500 food, 1500-2000 wood, 1500-2000 gold, and 1000-1200 stone at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 20-25 villagers to food, 12-15 to wood, 10-12 to gold, and 5-6 to stone.
imperial_age: Continue producing cavalry units and research Elite Kipchak and Hussar upgrades.
Use Kipchaks for hit-and-run attacks and Hussars for raiding and defending.
Have around 5000-6000 food, 3000-4000 wood, and 3000-4000 gold in the late Imperial Age.
Assign 40-50 villagers to food, 20-25 to wood, 16-20 to gold, and 8-10 to stone.
